TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Ye olde texture bug. Scene change should fix.

So, I downloaded the mod, put the game data into the game data folder, and when I loaded my save (1.4.1) the entire sky and water were bright white, and any planet that had an atmosphere or water was bright white in those locations. I then messed with all the settings trying to find what might work, however nothing would, still just all white. If there is any way to fix this please tell me.

Well, you don't put the gamedata folder *into* the gamedata folder. You put the scatterer folder that's inside the gamedata folder into your gamedata folder.

So I've been having an issue with Scatterer where at certain altitudes everything goes black except the body I'm orbiting. When I uninstall Scatterer the issue goes away. The only other mods I have installed are <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> and Near Future Solar. Any help is appreciated!

If a 1080ti is not enough to get the full eyecandy in KSP, then what is the recomended hardware??

I know KSP performance wise does not much care for your GPU, its the CPU that matters the most. But I always assumed the nice graphic stuff will be done on the GPU. Is this correct?

Personally I'm fine with a gtx 1060 and you could be fine with less, just keep in mind that the combination of <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr>+scatterer can be very expensive due to several reasons. I will also work on improving scatterer's performance.

**KSP:** 1.4 Windows

**Problem:** White Atmosphere/Ocean

**Mods installed:**

Scatterer - 0.0326

<abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr>

Distant Objects

KRE

Space Y

SVE

Flags

**Reproduction steps:**

You don't really need to reproduce it when it's constantly bright white. 

**Log:**

    Please do not paste logs in threads. Many browsers can't cope, and this prevents many people reading the threads.    

   Instead, copy logs to a file-sharing site and paste the link in your post.   

Many thanks!

I've always this issue in 1.4.1 (that I already had in 1.3.1). I've made some tests, and while I zooming out very far from ship view, I noticed that there is a sort of cube where my ship is in the center of it. And when the view is out from this cube the issue disappear. I got this issue only around Jool for now.

- [Jool issue with Scatterer and <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr>](https://imgur.com/a/tgt2a)
